Detailed Description

The editors use the input mapper for interpreting pressed keys to modify the content of the document. E. g. when pressing the key 2 a numeric input mapper inserts the number 2 into the document. The input mapper also takes care to navigate the caret of the editor.

Every input mapper has a unique ID which represents one of the following input mapper-classification: Numeric, MultiTap, PhoneNumber, Predictive, Date, Time, Calculator and Custom. The IDs 0 to 99 are reserved for APOXI, the IDs from 100 to 999 are reserved for ATL and third party applications. IDs starting from 1000 are open for customer projects.

The editors only deal with the ID of an input mapper. Which instance is returned for which ID is specified in the factory method EditConfig::AllocInputMapper, which may be customized for projects. This approach allows the implementation of custom input mappers without the need to modify the applications.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum InputMapper::Alphabet
 

Alphabet corresponding to 3GPP TS 23038 V430 (2001-09). Every input mapper may support one kind of alphabet (see GetAlphabet).

Enumerator:
UndefinedAlphabet 
SevenBitAlphabet 
EightBitAlphabet 
Ucs2Alphabet 

enum InputMapper::Id
 

The IDs 0 to 99 are reserved for APOXI, the IDs from 100 to 999 are reserved for IDEA and third party applications. IDs starting from 1000 are open for customer projects.

Enumerator:
Numeric  Allows to input numeric numbers from 0 to 9.
MultiTap  Allows to input characters by the multi tap input method. The multi tap table can be configured depending from the locale settings inside the class LocaleConfig.
MultiTab  Deprecated - use MultiTap instead (it was a spelling mistake).
PhoneNumber  Allows to input a phone number including the numbers 0 to 9 and the characters + and #.
Predictive  Predictive input (e. g. T9 or Zi8). It depends on EditConfig::AllocInputMapper which instance of an input mapper is returned. Using 'Predictive' instead of 'T9' or 'Zi8' is useful when the application should not rely on a specific input method.
Date  Allows to input a date. The date format can be specified depending from the locale settings inside the class LocaleConfig. This input mapper ID is used per default for the editor DateEditor.
Time  Allows to input a time. The date format can be specified depending from the locale settings inside the class LocaleConfig. This input mapper ID is used per default for the editor TimeEditor.
Calculator  Allows to input characters useful for a calculator (0 - 9, +, -, /, *).
IpAddress  Allows to input an IP address. This input mapper ID is used per default for the editor IpAddressEditor.
Zi8  Uses the predictive input eZi text.
Url  Allows to enter an URL. APOXI does not offer a default implementation for this input mapper ID.
EMailAddress  Allows to enter an e-mail address. APOXI does not offer a default implementation for this input mapper ID.
T9  Uses the predictive input method T9.
Name  Allows to enter a name.
Custom  Defined for custom input mappers. Note that the IDs 100 to 999 are reserved for ATL and third party applications.

enum InputMapper::NotificationType
 

Enumerator:
InsertedItem 
UpdatedContent 
SetText  Obsolete - use UpdatedContent instead.

Member Function Documentation

InputMapper::Alphabet InputMapper::GetAlphabet (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
Used alphabet corresponding to 3GPP TS 23038 V430 (2001-09). Per default UndefinedAlphabet is returned.

Reimplemented in ChineseT9InputMapper, EnglishT9InputMapper, CalculatorInputMapper, DateTimeInputMapper, IpAddrInputMapper, MultiTapInputMapper, NumericInputMapper, and PhoneNumberInputMapper.

Caret * InputMapper::GetCaret (   )  [virtual]
 

Factory method for creating the Caret. Use following implementation when using an own Caret:
if (m_caret == 0)
m_caret = new XxxCaret(GetEditor());
return m_caret
.

Reimplemented in MultiTapInputMapper.

Returns the editor the input mapper belongs too.

virtual INT InputMapper::GetId (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the unique input mapper ID. See also InputMapper::Id.

Implemented in T9InputMapper, Zi8InputMapper, CalculatorInputMapper, DateTimeInputMapper, IpAddrInputMapper, MultiTapInputMapper, NumericInputMapper, and PhoneNumberInputMapper.

BOOLEAN InputMapper::IsContentValid (   )  const [virtual]
 

Checks, whether the content of the editor is valid corresponding to the rules defined by the input mapper. Per default TRUE is returned. An invalid content can be made by e. g. directly inserting items into the editor-document.

BOOLEAN InputMapper::Notify (  NotificationType  type,
INT  index = 0,
const AtomItem *  item = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Is invoked by the editor, if an item has been inserted or the content of the editor has been changed. Overwriting this method allows the input mapper to synchronize its buffer with the editor-content.

Reimplemented in T9InputMapper, and Zi8InputMapper.

void InputMapper::OnGetFocus (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked by the editor if it has got the focus. This allows the input mapper to customize the look or to reset some properties.

Reimplemented in DateTimeInputMapper, and IpAddrInputMapper.

BOOLEAN InputMapper::OnKeyDown (  KeyCode  key_code  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked by the editor when a key has been pressed.

Reimplemented in CalculatorInputMapper, DateTimeInputMapper, IpAddrInputMapper, MultiTapInputMapper, NumericInputMapper, PhoneNumberInputMapper, and PredInputMapper.

BOOLEAN InputMapper::OnKeyUp (  KeyCode  key_code,
UINT32  duration
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked by the editor when a key has been released.

Reimplemented in T9InputMapper, and Zi8InputMapper.

BOOLEAN InputMapper::OnLongKeyPress (  KeyCode  key_code  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked by the editor when a key has been a long time. It is assured that InputMapper::OnKeyDown with the matching key code is invoked before.

Reimplemented in T9InputMapper, Zi8InputMapper, and PhoneNumberInputMapper.

void InputMapper::OnLoseFocus (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked by the editor if it has lost the focus. This allows the input mapper to customize the look or to reset some properties.

Reimplemented in DateTimeInputMapper, and IpAddrInputMapper.

editor Pointer to the editor the input mapper should belong too. */
